chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
items.plainText: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.

items.text: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
items.plainText: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.

items.text: For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
items.plainText: For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.

items.text: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
items.plainText: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.

items.text: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
items.plainText: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

items.text: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
items.plainText: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.

items.text: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
items.plainText: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.

items.text: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
items.plainText: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

items.text: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
items.plainText: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.

items.text: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
items.plainText: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.

items.text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
items.plainText: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.

items.text: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
items.plainText: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

items.text: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
items.plainText: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.

items.text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
items.plainText: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.

items.text: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
items.plainText: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

items.text: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
items.plainText: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

items.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
items.plainText: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

items.text: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
items.plainText: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

items.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
items.plainText: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

items.text: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
items.plainText: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

items.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
items.plainText: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.

items.text: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
items.plainText: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

items.text: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
items.plainText: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.

items.text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
items.plainText: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.

items.text: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
items.plainText: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

items.text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
items.plainText: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.

items.text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
items.plainText: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
